definition: fullness for the bold, famine for the timid (idiom)
pinyin: cheng1 si3 dan3 da4 de5 , e4 si3 dan3 xiao3 de5
simplified: 撑死胆大的，饿死胆小的
word: 撐死膽大的，餓死膽小的

definition: to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
